org.orgName: The District Court of The United States For THe Western District of Washington, Northern Division

div1.p: /copy of within order received and due service of same acknowledged this 30thday of September, 1915.
Geo Emory
Attorney for Petitioner
Original No. 3038
In the District Court of the United States for the Western District of Washington, Northern Division

p.add: In Re application of F. Medcraf for a Writ of Habeas Corpus

figure.p: Filed In The U.S. District Court, Western Dist. of Washington, Northern Division Sep301915 Frank L. Crosby, Clerk By Ed. M Lakin deputy 2x

div1.p: Geo. D. Emery Attorney for appellant
Telephone: Elliot 4606
419 Central Building Seattle, Wash.
At which office they consent that serivce of all subsequent papers, except writs and processes, may be made upon them
Bull Bros. "Just Printed"
Service of within exceptions this 30th day of Sept1915 and recepit of a copy thereof, admitted, Frank P. Helsell
Attorney for respdt
In the United States District Court In and For The Western District of Washington, Northern Division.
In the matter of the application of Francis Stephen Medccraf for a Writ of Habeas Corpus
Petition for Appeal

The Above Named Petitioner, conceiving himself aggrieved by the decision, order and judgement made and entered in the above entitled cause on the 30thday of Septemeber A. D. 1915, wherin and whereby it was considered, ordered and adjudged that the Writ of Habeas Corpus prayed for herein be denied and the petitioner remanded to the custody of the Sheriff of King County, Washinton, and that the statue of the State of Washinton set forth and complained of in the the petition herein was and is valid and not in conflict with the provisisons of Article XIV of the Amendments to the Constitution of the United States, and was and is not in conflict with the provisions of Article V of the Amendments to the Constitution of the United States, does hereby APPEAL from the said order, decision and judgment and from the whole thereof, to the SUPREME COURT OF THE UNITED STATES, for the reasons specifed in the Assignment of Errors filed herewith in this cause, and prays that this appeal may be allowed, and that a transcript of the record, papers and proceedings upon which sai judgment, findings and order was made and entered, duly authenticated, may be sent to the Supreme Court of the United States.
Dated September 30thA.D. 1915.
Attorney for Petitoner 419 Central Building Seattle, Wash.
The foregoing petition on appeal is granted, and the claim of appeal therein made is allowed. Dont in open Court, this 30thdat of Septeber A.D. 1915.
Jeremiah Neterer District Judge and the Presiding Judge before whom said cause was heard.
State of Washinton SS County of King

Francis Stephen Medcraf being first duly sworn says: That he is the petitioner named in the foregoing petition for appeal That he kows the contents of said petition and verily believes the same to be true.
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 30th day of September A.D. 1915. Geo. D. Emory Notary Public for Washington Residing at Seattle.
